intro: Zigadenus sachalinensis, commonly known as the Sakhalin deathcup, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellowish flowers that resemble those of the death cup. The plant produces toxic alkaloids, making it potentially lethal if ingested. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care and avoid contact with its leaves or flowers.
